# DiscordGo Skill

Expert guidance for building Discord bots with Go using the `bwmarrin/discordgo` library.

## What This Skill Provides

This skill helps with:
- Bot initialization and session management
- Event handlers and intents
- Slash commands with options
- Interactive components (buttons, select menus, modals)
- Message handling and embeds
- Context menus
- Autocomplete
- Permissions and security
- Best practices and troubleshooting

## Contents

### SKILL.md
Main skill file with core concepts, quick start guide, and common patterns covering:
- Bot session initialization
- Gateway intents
- Event handlers
- Slash commands
- Message components (buttons, selects, modals)
- Interaction handling
- Common patterns

### references/examples.md
Complete working examples for:
- Basic message bot (ping-pong)
- Slash commands with options
- Interactive components
- Modals and forms
- Context menus
- Autocomplete
- Message embeds
- DM handling

### references/api-reference.md
Quick reference with:
- All common session methods
- Event types
- Intent constants
- Interaction and response types
- Message flags
- Button and component styles
- Permission constants
- Option types
- Embed color codes
- Common code patterns

### references/best-practices.md
Production guidance including:
- Security best practices
- Performance optimization
- Error handling
- Rate limiting
- Common issues and solutions
- Debugging tips
- Testing strategies

## Usage

When you ask about Discord bot development in Go, this skill will automatically provide relevant guidance and examples from the DiscordGo library.

Example queries that trigger this skill:
- "Create a Discord bot in Go"
- "Add slash commands to my Discord bot"
- "How to handle button interactions in DiscordGo"
- "Create a modal form in Discord"
- "Send embeds in Discord with Go"

## Source

This skill is based on the official DiscordGo library examples and documentation from:
https://github.com/bwmarrin/discordgo
